item.title: Leaked Discord Messages Reveal Why Rockstar Fired 34 Employees
item.content:encoded:
The Rockstar Games employee dismissals have dominated gaming headlines for several weeks. Now, a new report has revealed the Discord messages that are believed to have led to the termination of 34 Rockstar Games workers.

Insider Gaming reported back in October about GTA 6 Workers allegedly being fired to prevent union forming. Since then, Rockstar Games has claimed that the fired employees were leaking information. There have been protests since, and the company has since been hit with legal action over the firings.

But now, a new development has seemingly uncovered the actual Discord messages at the root of everything.

Rockstar Games Allegedly Accessed Union Discord Server

People Make Games released an eye-opening video on November 24 titled: ‚ÄúThe Messages Rockstar Saw Before Firing 34 Union Members.‚Äù

The reporter claims that they have ‚Äúsince spoken to a Rockstar insider, who has shared screenshots with People Make Games of what they believe to be the messages sent just a few weeks ago on that Discord server, which directly contributed to the firings of these 34 former employees. We also know how Rockstar got hold of these messages as well.‚Äù

According to People Make Games, the source is ‚Äúnot one of the fired workers‚Äù and isn‚Äôt even part of the union. The Discord server has apparently been around since 2022 and consisted of various Rockstar employees.

The reporter‚Äôs source claims that ‚ÄúThey couldn‚Äôt recall a single example of any confidential game details being shared.‚Äù It‚Äôs said that the beginning of October 2025 saw Rockstar Games revise its policies pertaining to the company Slack‚Äîa messaging platform usually used by workplaces.

Various non-essential chats were removed, with the company claiming them to be a ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù and a source of ‚Äúpoor conduct‚Äù.

This ‚ÄúSlack purge‚Äù did not go down well. The union Discord server discussed these changes, with one individual saying: ‚ÄúI would really like to see the evidence for them being too much of a productivity hit. I can‚Äôt imagine it being worth the absolute dumpsterfire this will be for morale.‚Äù

It‚Äôs alleged that Rockstar‚Äôs Slack revision email was sent out after 5 PM‚Äîand employees can‚Äôt check their emails outside of work‚Äîand a second email about guidelines and conduct was also pushed. The emails were shared by people still in the office on Discord to inform other colleagues who hadn‚Äôt seen them yet.

‚ÄúThis led to one member of the Discord approaching studio management to express concerns about the discussions taking place,‚Äù the report adds. Additionally, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm told this either contributed to or kicked off an investigation into the Discord by the company, which does line up with the timings we now understand.‚Äù

The report claims it‚Äôs likely Rockstar did manage to access the union Discord server. Soon after, the whole world learned of the firings, with Rockstar presumably identifying individuals in the union chat who had broken guidelines, weren‚Äôt adhering to policy, and potentially attributed this to leaks.

You can see recreations of the Discord messages in the full video below.
